parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_ExtraCheckServers
parameter.description: A comma-delimited list of DNS servers to check.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_ActualBitRate
parameter.description: The current link speed of this interface (expressed in {{units}}).

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_ActualDuplexMode
parameter.description: The current duplex mode of this connection.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_DiscardFrameCnts
parameter.description: The count of discarded frames per queue.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_DiscardPacketsReceivedHipri
parameter.description: Number of discarded packets which were considered high priority.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_LedStatusNumberOfEntries
parameter.description: The number of instances of {{object|.X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_LedStatus.{i}.}}.

object.name: DeviceInfo.X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_LedStatus.{i}.
object.description: This object reflects the state of an LED or other indicator light.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of this LED. This text MUST be sufficient to distinguish this object from others.

parameter.name: Status
parameter.description: A description of the state of the indicator.

object.name: DeviceInfo.TemperatureStatus.X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_Fan.{i}.
object.description: This object represents information that the device has obtained via sampling a fan, blower, or other temperature management device.

parameter.name: Name
parameter.description: Name of this fan. This text MUST be sufficient to distinguish this fan from others.

parameter.name: RPM
parameter.description: Measured speed of the fan, in revolutions/minute.

parameter.name: DesiredRPM
parameter.description: The calculated speed the system believes the fan should run at, given the current temperature. Measured in revolutions/minute.

parameter.name: DesiredPercentage
parameter.description: Percentage for the level that the fan should run at.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_TextConfig
parameter.description: For debugging purposes, the current contents of the DHCP server configuration file (for example, dnsmasq.conf).

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_NTPServers
parameter.description: {{list}} List items represent NTP servers offered to DHCP clients.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_ClientID
parameter.description: Value of the DHCP Client Identifier (Option 61) as defined in {{bibref|RFC2132}} sent by the DHCP client.

parameter.name: IP4Address
parameter.description: The first IPv4 address known for the Host, or an empty string if there are no addresses.

parameter.name: IP6Address
parameter.description: The first IPv6 address known for the Host, or an empty string if there are no addresses.

object.name: Device.Hosts.Host.{i}.X_CATAWAMPUS_ORG_ClientIdentification.
object.description: Fingerprinting information to identify a client device.

parameter.name: DhcpFingerprint
parameter.description: A comma separated list of DHCP options requested by this client, in the order they were requested. Ex: 1,28,3,15,6,42

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_IP4Address
parameter.description: First IPv4 address from IPv4Address.{i}, or an empty string if there are no addresses.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_IP6Address
parameter.description: First IPv4 address from IPv6Address.{i}, or an empty string if there are no addresses.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_DiscardFrameCnts
parameter.description: The count of discarded frames per queue.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_DiscardPacketsReceivedHipri
parameter.description: Number of discarded packets which were considered high priority.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_RxPowerLevel_dBm
parameter.description: The RxPowerLevel in dBm.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_RxBcastPowerLevel_dBm
parameter.description: The RxBcastPowerLevel in dBm.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_RxSNR_dB
parameter.description: The Signal/Noise ratio in dB.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_TxBitloading
parameter.description: A description of the signal quality of each subchannel, one character per subchannel.

parameter.name: X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_RxBitloading
parameter.description: A description of the signal quality of each subchannel, one character per subchannel.

object.name: Device.IP.Diagnostics.X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_Speedtest.
object.description: This object provides access to an IP-layer performance test.

parameter.name: DiagnosticsState
parameter.description: Indicates availability of diagnostic data. {{enum}} If the ACS sets the value of this parameter to {{enum|Requested}}, the CPE MUST initiate the corresponding diagnostic test. When writing, the only allowed value is {{enum|Requested}}. To ensure the use of the proper test parameters (the writable parameters in this object), the test parameters MUST be set either prior to or at the same time as (in the same SetParameterValues) setting the {{param}} to {{enum|Requested}}. When requested, the CPE SHOULD wait until after completion of the communication session with the ACS before starting the diagnostic. When the test is completed, the value of this parameter MUST be either {{enum|Complete}} (if the test completed successfully), or one of the ''Error'' values listed above. If the value of this parameter is anything other than {{enum|Complete}}, the values of the results parameters for this test are indeterminate. When the diagnostic initiated by the ACS is completed (successfully or not), the CPE MUST establish a new connection to the ACS to allow the ACS to view the results, indicating the Event code ''8 DIAGNOSTICS COMPLETE'' in the Inform message. After the diagnostic is complete, the value of all result parameters (all read-only parameters in this object) MUST be retained by the CPE until either this diagnostic is run again, or the CPE reboots. After a reboot, if the CPE has not retained the result parameters from the most recent test, it MUST set the value of this parameter to {{enum|None}}. Modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, modifying any of the writable parameters in this object except for this one MUST result in the test being terminated and the value of this parameter being set to {{enum|None}}. While the test is in progress, setting this parameter to {{enum|Requested}} (and possibly modifying other writable parameters in this object) MUST result in the test being terminated and then restarted using the current values of the test parameters.

parameter.name: License
parameter.description: The license and test configuration to be used for the speed test invocation.

parameter.name: Arguments
parameter.description: Arguments to pass to the speedtest. This string will be broken into distinct arguments at whitespaces. Note that no shell is involved, and shell substitutions will not be performed.

parameter.name: Output
parameter.description: The output of the speed test run.

parameter.name: LastResultTime
parameter.description: The time of the most recent speedtest run.

object.name: Device.IP.Diagnostics.X_CATAWAMPUS-ORG_Isostream.
object.description: This object provides access to run an IP-layer jitter/throughput test.The results are very detailed and available only via the system logs.

parameter.name: ServerEnable
parameter.description: True if this device should accept incoming connections.

parameter.name: ServerTimeLimit
parameter.description: Automatically disable the server if it runs for more than this many seconds. If zero, there is no limit.

parameter.name: ClientEnable
parameter.description: True if this device should be running a client right now.

parameter.name: ClientTimeLimit
parameter.description: Automatically disable the client if it runs for more than this many seconds. If zero, there is no limit.

parameter.name: ClientRemoteIP
parameter.description: IP address or hostname of server to connect to. If this is set to the empty string, the client will attemp to connect to the nearest GFiberTV storage box if there is one on the LAN.

parameter.name: ClientMbps
parameter.description: The data rate to use for the client connection in Mbits/sec.
